intro: Heliophila namaquensis, commonly known as the Namibian sunflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, umbel-like inflorescence. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun, showcasing its heliophilous nature. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Heliophila namaquensis is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, demonstrating its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions.
